question: Alright -- Which one's Sapperstein? Okay, thanks.
answer: Yeah.

question: Wanted to see me?
answer: -- Follow me.

question: All what?
answer: Cannabis Sativa.

question: Professor Sapperstein, I'd like you to read something for me.
answer: Carrie Stetko.

question: Keep reading.
answer: United States Marshal.

question: Very good.
answer: Not this year, no.

question: Good. And how are you feeling right now?
answer: You think I'm crazy? Is that what you're saying?

question: You busy?
answer: What do you think?

question: I got a pilot at ASB who thinks he spotted a popsicle out on the ice.
answer: What flavor?

question: Don't know.
answer: And we were doing so well.

question: McClain Valley.
answer: McClain Valley? What was he doing out there? That's no man's land.

question: I've got a plane heading to ASB in an hour with some supplies for Winter-over.
answer: No -- just the picture. Bottom of the frickin' planet. Doc?

question: No -- just the picture. Bottom of the frickin' planet. Doc?
answer: Well, hello Marshal.

question: Keller.
answer: Out back. What are you doing here?

question: Checking the freezer for a popsicle.
answer: No shit?

question: It got called in this morning.
answer: Who spotted it?

question: Delfy, one of the pilots here.
answer: It's his first year down here. You know how that goes. My bet it was just debris, an old tent or something.

question: Yeah -- probably.
answer: Here's an idea -- why don't you stay here with me and we'll party, just the two of us. Put those cuffs of yours to work.

question: ...Were you the second guy from the front?
answer: Yeah.

question: Not interested.
answer: I'll have them boomerang back and pick up the load -- just have it ready. Good, have them check all the pressure levels on the hydraulics, then clear the exterior storage bins. Make sure we're not leaving anything out there. Sam told me you'd be coming up -- how's the sleigh ride?

question: Fine. I need a plane and that pilot who saw the popsicle.
answer: I'll have him meet you in the hangar.

question: Yeah, good.
answer: In less than three days we begin Winter-over. The sky will go completely black and stay that way for six months. Your core body temperatures have fallen to approximately 97 degrees. You are shivering uncontrollably -- losing basic motor skills. You're having trouble focusing on even the simplest tasks. In short, you are well on your way to dying, and it has only been two-hundred seconds. Always a pleasure to see you. Unlike most of the beaker-heads down here.

question: I wish -- We got a job. I need you to take a ride with me.
answer: Why's this crap always happen at the end of the season?

question: So it is.
answer: What's your gut say about this body?

question: My gut and I don't talk anymore.
answer: People change, Carrie.

question: Not you.
answer: I got a card from my Granddaughter inviting me to her fifth birthday party. You know, I've never even met her.

question: Or mentioned her. A grandchild? Doc, that's great.
answer: It got me thinking -- I need to be a better Grandfather, than I was a father. It's time I deal with my life. I've been down here a lot longer than I probably should have.

question: Delfy's taking us, Doc. He's the one who saw the body. C'mon, you'll be fine. I'll even hold your hand if you want. What were you doing out there?
answer: I went to evac a camp. Had to fly off route to get around a storm. Got down low to avoid some turbulence, and there it was.

question: That your son?
answer: Yeah, name's Nathan.

question: He's cute. Has your eyes.
answer: Lucky he got his momma's brain. Kid's smart.

question: So why aren't you with him?
answer: The bonus pay. Trying to buy a house. Give my boy a yard. His own room. Stuff I never had.

question: Hate it.
answer: Then why are you down here?

question: We all make stupid mistakes.
answer: It's right up here.

question: Never seen a dead guy?
answer: So do you. Think his name's Weiss. We Wintered-over last year with him. Played cards a couple of times.

question: The guy who cheated?
answer: Yeah. Geologist, I think.

question: Damn --
answer: Then where's his crampons -- his gear?

question: Maybe down the crevasse?
answer: Yeah, maybe --

question: One - two - three...
answer: Carrie, let's just bag him and put him on a plane to McMurdo.

question: It bothers me no one's reported him missing yet.
answer: Because maybe no one thinks he is.

question: How'd he get out there? There were no tracks.
answer: Sounds to me like you and your gut are talking again.

question: Nobody wants to get out of here more than I do, trust me, but right now -- we're all this guy has. Grab that side.
answer: Stirring up a few things?

question: ...I'll be alright.
answer: You know, this means a Federal Investigation, and we're witnesses. We may get stuck here.

question: I know.
answer: We both want to do the right thing Carrie -- but we also need to get off the ice. Right now we don't have to say a word. When they find something later -- hey, we didn't know. We were leaving, the body was frozen, we didn't have time to examine it. No one gets murdered in Antarctica. Think about it. Dead is dead.

question: Exactly, this is the first murder in Antarctica, Doc -- and I can't just pretend it didn't happen.
answer: Why did I know you were going to say that?

question: What camp was he with?
answer: I'm on my way to find out.

question: This is all I need right now.
answer: I'm sure his family's thinking the same thing.

question: That's not what I meant.
answer: I hate interrupting educational programming, but -- Chaplain.

question: I hate interrupting educational programming, but -- Chaplain.
answer: Am I in some kind of trouble?

question: What are they doing out there?
answer: Collecting meteorites.

question: English, please.
answer: Means it's a good place to look for meteorites.

question: I don't get it -- Weiss was no where near Delta One One.
answer: One sec --

question: Isn't that a little unusual this close to Winter-over?
answer: Yes, it is. Really unusual, actually.

question: -- You've been a little busy. Yeah, I can see that.
answer: Seventeen.

question: Delta One One, this is United States Marshall Carrie Stetko, come back, over. Vostok? This is Marshal Stetko, who's this? Mooney? What happened out there, Mooney? Where's Rubin? Getting drunk already?
answer: Just gearing my liver up in case I have to stay the next six months.

question: Murphy's contacting the Feds.
answer: You're making my day.

question: I'll do everything I can to get you off this ice, promise.
answer: I know you will.

question: Going to Vostok.
answer: What's he doing in Russia?

question: We're tracking it now.
answer: I need a plane to Vostok.

question: I don't control the weather -- you want to stay the winter, then don't be ready for your evac.
answer: I'm not asking.

question: What am I supposed to tell the deep drill ice core team getting picked up in four and a half?
answer: Tell them I took their plane. The Russians barely supply Vostok anymore. They have to barter with other bases for supplies. Some of these guys have been rotting here for years. Who's in charge? Stetko, US Marshal. I'm here to talk to an American named Mooney. I figured. Where is he?

question: Tell them I took their plane. The Russians barely supply Vostok anymore. They have to barter with other bases for supplies. Some of these guys have been rotting here for years. Who's in charge? Stetko, US Marshal. I'm here to talk to an American named Mooney. I figured. Where is he?
answer: You don't carry a gun?

question: Against the law -- Antarctica's the only place in the world you can't have one. Part of the Treaty.
answer: Doesn't that make you feel kind of naked?

question: All this crap on -- I prefer naked.
answer: Gettin' worse. Minus eighty-one. Wind at a hundred and ten knots.

question: Do you have to do that in front of me?
answer: Give you a hand?

question: Sure.
answer: Ever been on a rope-line in a whiteout?

question: Nope. Thoughts?
answer: Yeah, hold on tight.

question: Mooney? Hello? ...My God. Jack? What happened?
answer: When you didn't come back -- we went looking for you. Found a dead guy in the other building -- that Mooney?

question: Yeah. Someone got to him before I did. Then went after me.
answer: A couple hours.

question: Thanks.
answer: Whoever it was, could have flown out after the storm broke.

question: Let it go, Delfy.
answer: Until I met you, I hadn't seen any dead people. Now I'm at two.

question: Unless you want your head cracked, I wouldn't move. -- Let me see your hands. Let's see it -- slowly.
answer: You must be Stetko --

question: How do you know about Weiss?
answer: FBI notified us. Your base commander called it in.

question: This is part of a crime scene.
answer: I realize that, but considering the time constraints we're up against, let's be honest, taping and bagging everything isn't going to be an option.

question: I'll be sure to let the U.N. know if I find out anything.
answer: You heading out to Delta One One?

question: Maybe.
answer: I'll grab my bag.

question: Don't take this personally, but I don't need your help.
answer: If they've been digging out there, that's a direct violation of the United Nations treaty. We think they were digging. That makes it my business.

question: You don't dig for meteorites.
answer: And you don't get killed for them either. This is now a U.N. matter. I am within my rights to commandeer your pilot and plane if I have to.

question: Fine. But this is my investigation, understand? If you obstruct it in any way, I will have you detained.
answer: Fine.

question: No, but I have the feeling you're going to anyway.
answer: Why do you smell like suntan lotion?

question: Sam, I think these guys found something out there at the camp. I'm going to check it out. Until I find Rubin, no one leaves the ice. Not yet.
answer: We ready?

question: Guess so. What time is it?
answer: Two thirty.

question: A.M. or P.M.? Wonderful. I'll take this one. Rubin?
answer: Anything?

question: Someone's left leg took a hit, lost a lot of blood. What do you got?
answer: Their daily work log.

question: It's ground penetrating radar.
answer: Looks like they were surveying sections at a time.

question: Areas labeled?
answer: Yeah --

question: At Sections 101 and 102, they spent one day.
answer: Looks like they hit some really big meteors.

question: How far?
answer: About four miles.

question: Let's go see what they found.
answer: I want to check something out first.

question: North.
answer: Hurt?

question: Yeah, a little.
answer: How long have you been down here, Marshal?

question: Almost two years.
answer: What brought you to the ice? Everyone down here is running away from something.

question: Some shrink tell you that?
answer: Yeah, and that I should call my mother more often

question: And do you?
answer: Every Sunday.

question: Where do you plant your boots?
answer: They got me working out of Christchurch, New Zealand. Beautiful country. But this -- crazy place to make a living.

question: I came down to fill in for a Marshal for six weeks before Winter-over. I met someone, decided to stay.
answer: He give you that ring I saw? Tell you he was going to marry you?

question: No -- just gave me a headache.
answer: Flattered that you even looked.

question: This is shaved ice.
answer: Hold my legs!

question: I'm slipping!
answer: Almost got you.

question: I'm losing my grip.
answer: Carrie? Can you hear me?

question: ...I'm okay.
answer: Saw a rope in the Cat.

question: Cargo plane, but I don't recognize it.
answer: It's an Antanov-74. Russian made - - late fifties. No one's put these in the air for forty years.

question: Guess that makes three.
answer: This isn't funny --

question: Where's Pryce? What is that?
answer: Vodka.

question: Whoever got hurt, they dragged him out of here. There's blood all over the tunnel.
answer: It's the Cat!

question: Go!
answer: Sonofabitch!

question: Hold these.
answer: What're you doing?

question: All these planes used to have bail- out hatches.
answer: We came in through it.

question: I'll have the Doc take a peek when we're done.
answer: Murphy's looking for you.

question: Murphy? What the hell is he doing
answer: Came in on the evac.

question: I'm on 30 if you need me. Rubin's picture is in a file on my desk.
answer: Make sure I get that back.

question: Shit -- we've got to move up the evac.
answer: How much?

question: Six hours at least.
answer: Jesus, I got crew that's still not in.

question: Then get them in!
answer: You wanted to see me?

question: Where the hell have you been?
answer: Buried under 2 tons of ice. You?

question: Do me a favor, you find any more bodies, mind not parading them down the main corridor. I've got Newbies afraid to winterover, for Chirstsake. They want out on seats I don't have. And next time you want to take a Goddamn plane anywhere, you ask me.
answer: Sure thing, Chief.

question: We don't have enough supplies for all of us to Winter-over if we get stuck down here.
answer: It didn't work, Sam, because you couldn't keep your hands off every new woman who stepped foot on the ice down here. I was stupid enough to be one of them. Now if you could cut through your red tape for just one second, you would realize that someone's out there with six cannisters, possibly full of Uranium, and he wants to get it into the hands of some very bad people. And I'm trying to stop it -- so fuck asking you for shit, Sam.

question: Enough!
answer: You know what Doc, it's alright.

question: I'm worried about you. Is it going to take another attempt on your life to get you to finally slow down?
answer: You worry too much -- but it's what I like about you.

question: I striped him down to put him in a bodybag. There's only the puncture from the axe. No way, I would have noticed it. Why?
answer: Then it's gotta be Rubin.

question: Any word from the FBI?
answer: There's no way they're gonna make it. Not with that storm coming in over the peninsula.

question: Jesus, Carrie, how long did you let this go?
answer: When did I go to Vostok?

question: Feel that?
answer: No.

question: I stopped by the clinic... Doc told me.
answer: Pretty tough Marshal, huh?

question: Got Rubin's face all over Antarctica, but nobody's seen him yet.
answer: ...You ever kill anyone?

question: ...Unfortunately.
answer: Anyone you ever trusted?

question: No.
answer: I hadn't held a gun in my hand for over two years.

question: What happened?
answer: We were on a stakeout at a Holiday Inn in Miami, waiting for this buy to go down. I was excited, we'd been after this trafficker for a long time. Thought this bust would be my big chance to impress the brass. Anyway, guy's a no show. One hour went by, then two - - nothing.

question: It's what the Russians used to transport weapons grade materials in. They match the dimensions inside the safe. We're looking for six of these.
answer: These beakers where really in over their heads.

question: Who are you?
answer: -- Did Mooney talk to you? I didn't hear from him -- he was supposed to call me after you talked.

question: Mooney's dead.
answer: No...

question: And so's Weiss.
answer: And I'm next, I know it.

question: It's okay, you're safe, just put the knife down.
answer: Weiss didn't want to go through with it. Oh God. How did we let this happen?

question: It's okay, he's a doctor, he can help you.
answer: Yeah?

question: Rubin's here! He's on the run. Level one. White T-shirt. Jeans. Rubin, wait! Rubin -- I can help you! Door's jammed -- Shit, Rubin doesn't have any gear on.
answer: How long's he been out there?

question: What're you doing, you crazy bitch?
answer: Why did you kill those scientists, Keller? Was a four-way split too much for you?

question: Fuck you.
answer: Where is the uranium?

question: It's clean.
answer: Nothing. That bastard. What the hell are you up to, Keller?

question: I don't get it, why lie to us -- we have him either way. He's stuck here.
answer: He's buying time. Out of the way! Shit!

question: He's got nowhere to go, nowhere to hide.
answer: He won't try. He's a goddamn pilot.

question: ...I didn't see him.
answer: No! You stay awake! Press here. Hard. Hard or he will die!

question: He's not going to be number four! You're bleeding out. Freezing drops your pulse. We have to slow it down.
answer: No -- what's going --

question: Keller got out. He hurt Pryce -- he's bleeding bad. Where's Doc?
answer: In the clinic. About to bring the bodies out. What's --

question: Hey --
answer: Hey back.

question: You get him?
answer: Um-hm. Nope.

question: What did we miss? Think Keller cut and run without the stuff?
answer: After all this, no way. Keller didn't have it on the plane because he's got it hidden somewhere.

question: If he had made it out, he wouldn't have been crazy enough to come back for it.
answer: True -- what the hell was his plan...

question: Nothing -- I'll be right back. Someplace no one would ever think to look.
answer: If they had just gone along with it.

question: And we thought it was nukes the whole time.
answer: Keller said he knew someone in the states who could move the diamonds for us. It was a hell of a lot of money.

question: How did you get wrapped up in thing, Doc?
answer: Weiss got hurt on the plane. They were afraid to move him, so Mooney called me. Keller and I flew out. But they couldn't get the safe open -- Keller found a way.

question: Then Weiss got cold feet. It got ugly, didn't it -- and Keller killed him at Delta One One. Everything went to hell after that, didn't it, Doc.
answer: Keller thought he could kill his way out of this whole thing.

question: Doc -- stop.
answer: I'll cut you in, Carrie. There's at least 5 million in diamonds in there. That can buy both of us a nice life back in the world. How many times have we both talked about having a fresh start. Well, this is it. Those beakers finding that plane was a sign. A sign telling me it was time to go back. Now I have something to go back for.

question: There is no granddaughter, is there? This was about greed, plain and simple.
answer: No one will ever know. It's just me and you. We can take care of Pryce.

question: Dead is dead, right?
answer: Yes, yes, now you're getting it.

question: What's happened to you? There are four people dead! Four! People we knew. Doc looks at her. She's not sure if it's registering.
answer: It's either ignore all of this or kill me -- and you and I, we're too good of friends for me to force you to make that choice.

question: Doc, your not thinking straight.
answer: Ya know, it's really warm. I'm gonna take a walk -- try and cool off.

question: Doc, please.
answer: Remember, Carrie -- freedom's just a sunrise away.
